III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was at the facility for six months and was put out of the
group home on 03/28/2024, due to getting into an argument with
the unnamed owner of the group home over a streaming service
and "aging out" of the group home. Youth has not been hurt or
harmed. Youth is now homeless.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/4/24.
Youth A reported on 3/28/24, he was upset about not being able
to watch TV because he was suspended from school. Youth A
reported he walked out of the facility approximately 3-8 times on
his own. Youth A reported staff followed him and tried to pick him
up, but he refused to get in the car. Youth A reported he could not
remember what staff were involved. Youth A reported he
remembered Chief Administrator (CA) talked to him one time
when he came back and tried to convince him to stay. Youth A
reported when he returned to the facility the following day,
Licensee Designee (LD) took him to the hospital to be evaluated
for suicidal ideations because he was thinking of committing
suicide or self-harming. Youth A reported no one kicked him out or
told him to leave the facility, including LD. Youth A reported
everything was fine at the facility, and he has no concerns with
any staff or anything else. Youth A reported all staff handled
themselves appropriately and tried to encourage him to stay, but
he wouldn’t listen.
Licensee Designee (LD) was interviewed via phone on 4/2/24
and face to face at the facility on 4/4/24. LD reported Youth A
had issues with not having his cell phone and wanting to add a
Netflix account. LD reported he explained to Youth A he had
consequences due to an incident Youth A had at the facility as
well as an incident that happened at school. LD reported he
explained they needed to resolve the issues at hand instead of
focusing on the cell phone. Youth A was still upset, so LD left the
facility to give some space. Shortly after, LD received a call stating
Youth A had left the facility and Staff 2 was following him. LD met
Youth A and Staff 2 at the gas station down the road. LD reported
2

he tried to convince Youth A to get into the car so they could go
back to the facility, but Youth A refused. LD reported he asked
Youth A “is this really what you want to do?” and Youth A
responded “yes”. LD reported Youth A began walking away, and
Staff 2 continued to follow him. LD reported early the next day,
Youth A returned to the facility. LD took Youth A to get evaluated
at the hospital because he found out Youth A was at the hospital
from 4-6:30am for suicidal ideations when he was AWOL from the
facility. LD reported during the hour drive to the hospital, Youth A
was not fully de-escalated, but on the way back he was, so they
were able to have a very productive conversation. LD reported he
told Youth A he is always going to be there to support him. LD
reported he never told Youth A to leave the home or told Youth A
he was kicked out because he aged out.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
4/4/24. CA reported she was notified on 3/28/24 Youth A went
AWOL, and the police had been notified. CA reported she was
present when Staff 2 brought Youth A back to the facility after his
first AWOL on 3/28/24. CA reported when Youth A walked in, she
asked him how it was going and he replied, “I’m leaving”. CA
reported she told Youth A she understood he was upset and
asked if he would go next door with her to talk. Youth A declined
and stated there was nothing to talk about. CA reported Staff 1
began passing out medications from the staff office. CA reported
when Staff 1 attempted to give Youth A his medications, he
declined and said there was no point because he was leaving. CA
reported Youth A began to walk towards the staff office, so she
thought he was going to take his medications. Instead, Youth A
leaned into the office and grabbed his cell phone sitting in a bag
inside the door. CA reported Youth A said he was going to his
room to change his clothes and he didn’t want anyone coming in.
CA reported she went with him to ensure his safety, so he went
into his closet and changed. CA reported Youth A told her he was
upset and didn’t want to stay at the facility any longer. CA reported
she tried to talk to him about why he didn’t want to stay and
encouraged him to stay. Youth A told CA he wanted his money
and belongings so he could leave, and CA told Youth A she would
provide those items to his foster care worker. Youth A grabbed
two pairs of shoes, put them in a knapsack, grabbed his cell
phone, said, “I’m out of here”, and walked out the door. CA
reported she got in her car and began following him down the
street, but he turned around and started walking back towards the
facility, so she was going to let LD handle it because he had
arrived. CA reported she received two additional calls that evening
stating Youth A left and came back. CA reported the following
3

morning, Youth A returned to the facility and CA met him there to
try and encourage him to stay. CA reported Youth A disclosed he
was in the emergency room for part of the night, trying to get
himself admitted. CA reported LD took Youth A to a different
hospital to be assessed due to suicidal ideations. CA reported no
one told Youth A he was kicked out of the facility, and no one said
he had to leave because he aged out.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/2/24.
Staff 1 reported on 3/28/24, Youth A told LD he made a new
Netflix account. LD asked Youth A why he made a new account
and inquired as to how he was going to pay for it. Youth A
responded he didn’t know. Staff 1 reported Youth A asked for his
cell phone and LD told Youth A he needed to earn his cell phone
back. Staff 1 reported LD left the facility. After LD left, Youth A
became upset and said LD was upset with him. Staff 1 reported
she and Staff 2 explained to Youth A he wasn’t in trouble and LD
wasn’t mad, but he needed to work on some things, and he could
earn his cell phone back if he started doing better. Youth A told
Staff 1 and Staff 2 he was going to leave. Staff 1 reported they
told Youth A if he left, they would call the police, but Youth A
stated the police couldn’t do anything because he’s 18. Staff 1
reported she and Staff 2 continued to encourage Youth A not to
leave and convince him he wasn’t in trouble, but he refused to
listen. Staff 1 reported Youth A said, “I’m listening to y’all, but after
you’re done talking, I’m leaving and I’m going to show y’all the
police aren’t going to do anything”. Staff 1 reported after they
stopped talking, Youth A grabbed his jacket and walked out of the
house. Staff 1 reported she called LD while Staff 2 called the
police. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 grabbed the car keys and left so
she could trail Youth A. Staff 1 reported shortly later, Staff 2
brought Youth A back to the home. Staff 1 reported as soon as
Youth A entered the home, he was asking her for his phone. Staff
1 reported CA was present and was trying to de-escalate Youth A,
but he wouldn’t talk to her. Staff 1 reported while CA was talking to
Youth A, Staff 1 went into the staff office to get medications ready
for the youth. Staff 1 reported Youth A walked into the staff office
without permission and grabbed his cell phone out of the bag in
the office while CA was talking to him. Staff 1 reported she
finished passing out medications, and then left because her shift
was over. Staff 1 reported CA was in another area of the home
still talking to Youth A when she left. Staff 1 reported when she
was pulling out of the parking lot, she saw Youth A walk out of the
house again and called LD to let him know. LD reported he was
already aware. Staff 1 reported no one, including LD, told Youth A
to leave the home or that he was kicked out because he aged out.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/4/24.
Staff 2 reported on 3/28/24, Youth A told LD he got another Netflix
account. Staff 2 reported LD said he had enough because Youth
A kept asking for more money and more stuff, but he was
suspended from school. Staff 2 reported LD left, and Youth A
expressed he was confused why LD was upset with him. Staff 2
reported she and Staff 1 told Youth A he was asking for a lot
considering he was suspended from school, and if he’s not going
to do what he’s supposed to do, he will have consequences, such
as not having his phone. Staff 2 reported Youth A said, “Well I can
leave. I don’t need to be here. I’m 18 and I’ve aged out”. Staff 2
reported she and Staff 1 were encouraging Youth A to stay, but
Youth A said, “I want to go to jail. When you’re done talking to me,
I’m going to get up and leave”. Staff 2 reported after they stopped
talking, Youth A got his shoes and coat on and then left the
facility. Staff 2 reported she left the house to follow him in the car
and trailed him for about 90 minutes. Staff 2 reported she
repeatedly tried to persuade Youth A to get in the car so they
could go back to the facility, but he refused. Staff 2 reported the
police came about 30 minutes later and talked to him for about 15-
30 minutes. Staff 2 reported Youth A finally got into the car with
her, and they went back to the facility. Staff 2 reported when they
were in the car, Youth A told her he was going to leave again, and
she was trying to convince him to stay. Staff 2 reported when they
went into the house, she went downstairs while Staff 1 and CA
were upstairs with Youth A. Staff 2 reported she wasn’t sure what
happened, but when she came upstairs, Youth A had changed his
clothes, and he was leaving again. Staff 2 reported she couldn’t
go after him because she was the only staff at the facility, so she
called the police to report him AWOL. Staff 2 reported he didn’t
come back to the facility again while she was on shift. Staff 2
reported no one, including LD, told Youth A to leave the home or
that he was kicked out because he aged out.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 4/2/24. Staff 3 reported
she worked third shift from 3/28/24-3/29/24, and when she arrived
at the facility, Youth A was AWOL. Staff 3 reported early on
3/29/24, the police brought Youth A back to the facility with Taco
Bell. Staff 3 reported Youth A told her he was there to eat his food,
get his stuff and he was leaving again, which is exactly what he
did. Staff 3 reported as soon as Youth A left again, she called the
police to report him AWOL. Staff 3 reported Youth A didn’t come
back or have any contact with her for the remainder of the shift.
5

Clinical Manager (CM) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 4/4/24 and via phone on 5/2/24. CM reported she
became involved when she came into work on 3/29/24, and Youth
A was still AWOL. CM reported she knew Youth A had been to
Bronson Hospital early in the morning because LD received an
alert from Bronson MyChart. CM reported the hospital discharge
paperwork marked Youth A as homeless because he’s 18, so they
had no reason to call a guardian. CM reported Staff 2 called her
and stated she had been in contact with Youth A, so Staff 2 was
going to pick him up. Staff 2 brought Youth A back to the facility.
CM reported Youth A told her he had left because he was upset
he couldn’t have his phone. CM reported she discussed the
circumstances with him and expressed how concerned they were
for his safety and well-being. CM reported Youth A told her he
didn’t want to be at the facility anymore. CM stated she spoke with
Youth A about the process for discharge and how it’s important
they take the proper steps to transition him so he’s safe. CM
reported Youth A stated he wasn’t open to conversation, and he
wasn’t staying at the facility. CM reported LD talked to Youth A
and Youth A agreed to go with LD to the hospital for an
assessment due to suicidal ideations.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/4/24. Administrator reported after she was done working on
3/28/24, Staff 2 called her and said Youth A left the facility.
Administrator reported she met them up the street and tried to talk
to Youth A to encourage him to go back to the facility. When he
refused, Administrator reported they called the police. When the
police arrived, they had a discussion with Youth A and Youth A
agreed to get into Staff 2’s car. Administrator reported Staff 2 took
Youth A back to the facility and then Administrator went home.
Administrator reported Youth A was very adamant he didn’t want
to talk or explain why he was mad. Administrator reported Youth A
said he didn’t want to go back, but never told her anyone kicked
him out or he couldn’t go back.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email from Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) dated
4/1/24 states on 3/28/24 Youth A left the facility on his own
after he got upset about his phone. FCW reported he talked
to Youth A on Friday and encouraged him to go back to the
facility, but Youth A refused to go back. FCW reported he
spoke with Youth A on the phone after he returned from
AWOL.
6

• Incident Report authored by CM outlines the timeline of
events from 3/28/24-3/29/24 and notes Youth A left the
home on his own accord three different times, which was
consistent with interviews conducted.
• Kalamazoo Department of Public Safety (KDPS) Police
Report #24-003926 from 3/28/24-3/29/24 authored by Law
Enforcement (LE). LE spoke with Youth A via phone. Youth
A told LE he was not harmed or in danger but did not want
to go back to the facility. Youth A admitted he was “acting
up” and was still upset about his argument with LD. LE
noted Youth A was adamant he did not need to reside at
the facility any longer because he had aged out of the
program. LE noted Youth A was brought back to the facility
by Support Person but left again shortly after arriving.
• Facility Program Statement notes discharge planning
begins at admission and involves all members of the
treatment team. Discharge planning focuses on identifying
services necessary at discharge and aftercare services will
be provided via phone or visits for up to 3 months post-
discharge. General outcome goals consist of family
reunification, entrance into independent living, or adoption,
if possible.
• LD has no disciplinary actions in his employee file.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, this
violation is not established. Youth A reported he left the home on
his own accord and was not kicked out, which was confirmed by
all employees interviewed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all appliLDble
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
